properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 5:31PM EST until February 7 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers
in North Carolina...

Tuckasegee River At Bryson City affecting Swain County.


.Runoff from previous heavy rain will result in the river remaining
above flood stage but falling.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Tuckasegee River At Bryson City.
* until Friday evening.
* At  5:16 PM Thursday the stage was 13.2 feet.
* Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* FORECAST: The river has crested and will falling through the weekend.
The river will fall below Minor Flood Stage on Friday.
* Impact...At 13.5 feet...Stores along Gibson and Island streets will
be flooded. Floodwater levels will be similar to the flooding that
occurred on September 17, 2004.
* Impact...At 11.0 feet...The river will overflow its banks in the
park downtown, and low lying areas along Island and Collins Streets
will begin to flood. Toot Hollow Branch that flows into the river
will likely overflow its banks and flood areas along the branch
especially along Waters Street.  Bear Hunter Campground will
experience more significant flooding.
* Impact...At 10.0 feet...Low lying areas between Bryson Walk and the
river will flood. Upstream between Main Street and the river, low
lying areas including parts of the Bear Hunter Campground will
flood.
properties.instruction:
The latest stages and forecasts for rivers can be found on our web
page at http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp

Please report high water...flooding and landslides to the National
Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free...1...8 0
0...2 6 7...8 1 0 1...or by posting on our Facebook page...or tweet
it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and
the specific location where it occurred.
